title: Threat Actors, TTPs, and Phishing
excerpt: Details the main goal of studying Threat Actors and their TTPs (Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures), including common methods like Phishing, and defines the different types of malicious actors.

full_content.heading: Threat Actors and TTPs
full_content.text: The main goal of studying **Threat Actors & TTPs** (Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures) is knowing who the attackers are (individuals, groups, cybercriminals, or state-sponsored organizations) and how they function. **TTPs** are the strategies they employ to execute assaults.

full_content.heading: Types of Threat Actors
full_content.text: Threat actors include insider threats, hackers, cybercriminals, and even state-sponsored organizations. These individuals or groups carry out malevolent actions against networks, systems, or organizations.

full_content.heading: Phishing as a Common TTP
full_content.text: Phishing is a popular technique used by threat actors to obtain initial access. They trick people into disclosing private information or clicking on harmful links to execute their assaults.
